result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas M Diels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

DNA Surcharge previously done.
   If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED for use at Agent's discretion.

Detainer lifted from Redgranite Correctional Institution.

Defendant Nicholas M Diels in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count #1 with the repeater struck.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1 as stated.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Schleis makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
30 months Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days) Concurrent to any sentence
15 months of Initial Confinement
15 monthsof Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 2 Years
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
Seek employment;
Condition Time: 30 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS -  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: Previously done
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
